content:
• Thursday, November 3, 2011
  • MATN

    Oxigene (OXGN) shares tumble over 35% after hours following a mixed report on its Phase 2 study...

    Oxigene (OXGN) shares tumble over 35% after hours following a mixed report on its Phase 2 study of its cancer drug Zybrestat. Although tests appear to show some improvement when combined with other treatments, the drug shows no discernible survival benefit in stand-alone form.

     
     
     
     
    | 6:51 PM
  • SWKS

    Skyworks Solutions (NASDAQ:SWKS) reports an in-line FQ4, but says its FQ1 will come in below...

    Skyworks Solutions (NASDAQ:SWKS) reports an in-line FQ4, but says its FQ1 will come in below estimates due to near-term market weakness. It now sees its EPS at $0.50, versus Street expectations for $0.53. Shares -5.4% AH.
     
     
     
     
    | 6:38 PM | 2 Comments
  • GEC

    Openwave (OPWV) surges 29.3% AH after announcing a patent licensing deal with Microsoft...

    Openwave (OPWV) surges 29.3% AH after announcing a patent licensing deal with Microsoft (NASDAQ:MSFT). The deal, reported 2 months after Openwave sued Apple (NASDAQ:AAPL) and Research In Motion (RIMM), was the main factor behind the company's blowout FQ1 results (revenue of $52.4M and EPS of $0.11 vs. consensus of $34.3M and -$0.07).

     
     
     
     
    | 5:30 PM
  • MTZ

    Infrastructure contractor MasTec (NYSE:MTZ) falls 13.3% AH after reporting Q3 results. Though...

    Infrastructure contractor MasTec (NYSE:MTZ) falls 13.3% AH after reporting Q3 results. Though revenue of $865.3M beat by $89M and was up 39% Y/Y, EPS of $0.36 was only in-line, and up just a penny from the year-ago period. MasTec attributes this margin decline to bad weather in the Marcellus Shale Basin, which has continued in Q4, and weak margins in its wireless business.

     
     
     
     
    | 5:22 PM
  • MSFT

    LinkedIn (LNKD) is now down 12.2% AH following its Q3 report (I, II), after the company...

    LinkedIn (LNKD) is now down 12.2% AH following its Q3 report (I, II), after the company announces it's filing for a $100M stock offering, in part to "facilitate an orderly distribution of shares and increase the company's float." LinkedIn's IPO lockup period ends on Nov. 15.

     
     
     
     
    | 5:05 PM | 3 Comments
  • SD

    Sandridge Energy (NYSE:SD) swings to a gain in Q3, beating both EPS and revenue estimates for...

    Sandridge Energy (NYSE:SD) swings to a gain in Q3, beating both EPS and revenue estimates for the quarter. Total oil production rose 14% Y/Y, but the company lowers overall FY11 estimates, now seeing 23.4 MMBOE, below previous expectations of 23.9 MMBOE. Shares -4.8% AH.

     
     
     
     
    | 4:54 PM | 1 Comment
  • SPWR

    SunPower (SPWRA) gains 8.5% AH after reporting Q3 revenue of $705.4M (+28% Y/Y) and EPS of...

    SunPower (SPWRA) gains 8.5% AH after reporting Q3 revenue of $705.4M (+28% Y/Y) and EPS of $0.16; the former missed by $7.2M, but the latter beat by $0.10. Though the solar module vendor is now guiding for 2011 revenue of $2.4B-$245B (well below a Street forecast of $2.79B), it looks like that piece of bad news was baked in.

     
     
     
     
    | 4:54 PM
  • MSFT

    More on LinkedIn's Q3: Revenue growth a slight acceleration from Q2's 120%. Members up 13% Q/Q...

    More on LinkedIn's Q3: Revenue growth a slight acceleration from Q2's 120%. Members up 13% Q/Q to 131.2M, unique visitors/month up 7% Q/Q to 87.6M. Hiring Solutions revenue +160% Y/Y ( 51% of total), Marketing Solutions +113% (29% of total), Premium Subscriptions +81% (20% of total). U.S. 67% of revenue, international 33%. LNKD now -9.1% AH. (PR)

     
     
     
     
    | 4:21 PM
  • FLR

    Fluor (NYSE:FLR): Q3 EPS of $0.78 misses by $0.07. Revenue of $6.04B (+9.6% Y/Y) misses by...

    Fluor (NYSE:FLR): Q3 EPS of $0.78 misses by $0.07. Revenue of $6.04B (+9.6% Y/Y) misses by $240M. New 12M-share repurchase program (7.1% of outstanding shares). FLR -6% AH. (PR)
     
     
     
     
    | 4:18 PM
  • MSFT

    LinkedIn (LNKD): Q3 EPS of $0.06 beats by $0.10. Revenue of $139.5M (+126% Y/Y) beats by $12.1M....

    LinkedIn (LNKD): Q3 EPS of $0.06 beats by $0.10. Revenue of $139.5M (+126% Y/Y) beats by $12.1M. Company expects Q4 revenue of $154M-$158M vs. $147.8M consensus. Shares -2.9% AH. (PR)
     
     
     
     
    | 4:07 PM
  • SBUX

    Starbucks (NASDAQ:SBUX): FQ4 EPS of $0.37 beats by $0.01. Revenue of $3.03B (+7% Y/Y; +15% on...

    Starbucks (NASDAQ:SBUX): FQ4 EPS of $0.37 beats by $0.01. Revenue of $3.03B (+7% Y/Y; +15% on comparative 13-week basis) beats by $80M. Same-store sales up 9%. Raises quarterly dividend 31%. Shares +1.7% AH. (PR)
     
     
     
     
    | 4:07 PM
  • GSVC

    GSV Capital (GSVC +8.8%) is surging ahead of tomorrow's Groupon (NASDAQ:GRPN) IPO. The...

    GSV Capital (GSVC +8.8%) is surging ahead of tomorrow's Groupon (NASDAQ:GRPN) IPO. The publicly-traded VC fund has taken small stakes in Groupon, Facebook, Twitter, Zynga, and other high-flying startups, albeit often at steep valuations.
     
     
     
     
    | 3:57 PM
  • CBEY

    Cbeyond (CBEY -18.8%) tanks today after Suntrust cuts the shares to Neutral. The firm cites...

    Cbeyond (CBEY -18.8%) tanks today after Suntrust cuts the shares to Neutral. The firm cites execution risks and higher costs related to the company's strategy shift to target larger-sized customers and focus on cloud services.
     
     
     
     
    | 3:57 PM
  • HOV

    Shares of Hovnanian Enterprises (HOV -6.4%) dip after S&P downgrades the company, saying its...

    Shares of Hovnanian Enterprises (HOV -6.4%) dip after S&P downgrades the company, saying its latest offer to exchange debt technically constitutes a form of default.

     
     
     
     
    | 3:52 PM
  • NUVA

    NuVasive (NUVA -2.5%) underperforms after a court filing discloses Medtronic (MDT +2.7%) is...

    NuVasive (NUVA -2.5%) underperforms after a court filing discloses Medtronic (MDT +2.7%) is seeking a permanent ban on NuVasive spinal surgery devices that infringe on Medtronic's IP. NuVasive tumbled in September following an adverse court ruling in its patent dispute with Medtronic.
     
     
     
     
    | 3:48 PM
  • CECO

    While shares of Career Education (CECO +11.5%) are cut in half in two days, for-profit education...

    While shares of Career Education (CECO +11.5%) are cut in half in two days, for-profit education rival Strayer (STRA +14.7%) is among today's big gainers after reporting a solid Q3 EPS beat, a $100M stock buyback, and plans for eight additional campuses in 2012. The results came even as student totals fell 11%, and new-student enrollments fell 15%.

     
     
     
     
    | 3:45 PM
  • EL

    Estee Lauder (EL +18.7%) tops the S&P leader board after reporting a stellar FQ1, increasing...

    Estee Lauder (EL +18.7%) tops the S&P leader board after reporting a stellar FQ1, increasing guidance for its just-started fiscal year, declaring a two-for-one stock split and hiking its annual dividend. Estee Lauder continues to gain share of the high-end beauty market, with its "best-in-class brand portfolio and developing market growth," Stifel Nicolaus says.
     
     
     
     
    | 3:30 PM
  • CVD

    Drug research firm Covance (CVD -2.4%) trades lower, erasing an early 4% gain on solid Q3...

    Drug research firm Covance (CVD -2.4%) trades lower, erasing an early 4% gain on solid Q3 results as revenue grew in both segments. Operating margin swung to 9.4% from negative 16.1%. The company also narrows its full-year earnings estimate from between $2.60 - $2.80 to $2.70.

     
     
     
     
    | 3:26 PM
  • LUK-OLD

    In for a penny, in for a pound. Leucadia (LUK-OLD -1.5%) buys another 1M shares of Jefferies...

    In for a penny, in for a pound. Leucadia (LUK-OLD -1.5%) buys another 1M shares of Jefferies (JEF -3.8%) at $11.84. The buy increases Leucadia's stake in the company by about 2%. (previous)

     
     
     
     
    | 3:17 PM | 1 Comment
  • AWK

    American Water Works (AWK +2.5%) trades higher after reporting a mixed Q3, beating on a per...

    American Water Works (AWK +2.5%) trades higher after reporting a mixed Q3, beating on a per share basis but coming up short on revenue. Stringent cost controls gave a solid boost to bottom line margins, as profit rose 11% Y/Y, and operating margins grew nominally from 35.6% to 36.7%.

     
     
     
     
    | 3:12 PM
  • CAR

    Avis Budget Group (CAR -5.4%) dips after its Q3 earnings met analysts estimates but fell short...

    Avis Budget Group (CAR -5.4%) dips after its Q3 earnings met analysts estimates but fell short on revenue. Net earnings dropped 8.9% Y/Y due to expenses related to its Avis Europe acquisition and its failed bid for Dollar Thrifty (DTG +0.6%).
     
     
     
     
    | 3:03 PM
  • CXO

    Concho Resources (CXO +2.2%) Q3 easily beats estimates, boosted by derivative gains and a surge...

    Concho Resources (CXO +2.2%) Q3 easily beats estimates, boosted by derivative gains and a surge in revenue. Earnings doubled, with oil production growth soaring over 73% as the production assets from its recent purchase of privately held Marbob Energy come on line.

     
     
     
     
    | 2:42 PM
  • MGM

    Shares of MGM fall off 4% after the casino operator reports a wider-than-expected loss, while...

    Shares of MGM fall off 4% after the casino operator reports a wider-than-expected loss, while revenue improved on the strength in Macau. FBR notes the company may have hit an unlucky streak at its Las Vegas gaming tables: "The miss vs. our estimate was primarily from Las Vegas, where EBITDA was $10M lower than we projected."

     
     
     
     
    | 2:38 PM
  • S

    Clearwire (CLWR -13.5%) is now off sharply following its Q3 report (I, II), as a subscriber...

    Clearwire (CLWR -13.5%) is now off sharply following its Q3 report (I, II), as a subscriber guidance hike is offset by the retracting of a prior forecast to deliver positive EBITDA in Q1. Management's failure to provide assurances during its CC about receiving the funding needed to build a 4G LTE network for Sprint (S +4.4%) could also be an issue.

     
     
     
     
    | 2:31 PM
  • CPE

    Callon Petroleum (CPE +24%) soars after its Q3 EPS blows out estimates, boosted by strong...

    Callon Petroleum (CPE +24%) soars after its Q3 EPS blows out estimates, boosted by strong hedging results in its natural gas unit. Operating revenue jumped 64% over a prior-year results that were marred by low output. Production growth rose 23% Y/Y, as the company transitions its focus from offshore wells in the Gulf of Mexico to its inshore operations in the Permian Basin.

     
     
     
     
    | 2:19 PM
  • ABMD

    Abiomed (NASDAQ:ABMD), a maker of heart-related medical devices, gains 21.2% after reporting FQ2...

    Abiomed (NASDAQ:ABMD), a maker of heart-related medical devices, gains 21.2% after reporting FQ2 revenue of $29.5M (+26% Y/Y) and EPS of $0.09, beating consensus by $1.8M and $0.18. The EPS beat was fueled by a 4% Q/Q increase in the company's gross margin, to 81%.

     
     
     
     
    | 2:09 PM
  • CECO

    Shares of Career Education (CECO -14.3%) suffer another beating on top of yesterday's 48% swoon,...

    Shares of Career Education (CECO -14.3%) suffer another beating on top of yesterday's 48% swoon, dropping to an 11-year-low $6.95 at one point, after the for-profit educator's disappointing Q3 results and departure of its CEO. Wunderlich downgrades shares to Hold and reduces its target price to $12 from $23.

     
     
     
     
    | 1:55 PM | 3 Comments
  • PRU

    Prudential Financial (PRU -1.3%) trades lower after its Q3 misses estimates. Profit rose 29% Y/Y...

    Prudential Financial (PRU -1.3%) trades lower after its Q3 misses estimates. Profit rose 29% Y/Y due to a surge in premiums in its financial services business, but higher insurance and annuity benefit payouts pressured top line margins. Additionally, the company lowers its operating profit forecast, now expecting around $6.20 - $6.60 per share, below Street estimates of $7.43.

     
     
     
     
    | 1:51 PM
  • T

    DirecTV (DTV +6.4%) is shooting higher, as investors pay more heed to its strong subscriber...

    DirecTV (DTV +6.4%) is shooting higher, as investors pay more heed to its strong subscriber growth than its EPS miss. Shares received a further boost this afternoon after the company announced it has signed a 3-year extension of its reseller deal with AT&T (NYSE:T); the new deal lasts through March 2015.

     
     
     
     
    | 1:50 PM | 1 Comment
  • ADM

    Archer Daniels Midland (ADM +2%), which sold off a little on Tuesday following its FQ1 report,...

    Archer Daniels Midland (ADM +2%), which sold off a little on Tuesday following its FQ1 report, trades higher today after boosting its quarterly dividend to $0.175/share. The dividend boost leave ADM with an annual yield of 2.4%.

     
     
     
     
    | 1:37 PM
  • WLT

    Walter Energy (WLT +3%) rebounds off early morning losses after posting Q3 revenues that fell...

    Walter Energy (WLT +3%) rebounds off early morning losses after posting Q3 revenues that fell less than expected. Profit still managed to dip 44% Y/Y, as production problems due to heavy rains significantly weakened output, but were mitigated somewhat by higher coal prices. Operating margin also imploded, down to 21.5% from 44.8%, as overall costs more than doubled.

     
     
     
     
    | 1:29 PM
  • ANDV

    Shares of Tesoro (TSO +3%) gain after its Q3 EPS handily beats estimates. Net income soared to...

    Shares of Tesoro (TSO +3%) gain after its Q3 EPS handily beats estimates. Net income soared to $345M, up from $56M a year prior, as the company benefited from its access to discounted crude oil and increased refinery activity.

     
     
     
     
    | 1:06 PM
  • ALK

    Alaska Airlines (NYSE:ALK) trades higher, up 4.7%, after the firm reports a 6% Y/Y increase in...

    Alaska Airlines (NYSE:ALK) trades higher, up 4.7%, after the firm reports a 6% Y/Y increase in traffic on a 5.1% gain in capacity. Helping keeps its goodwill flowing with customers, the carrier also reports on-time arrivals skyrocketed to 91.8%.

     
     
     
     
    | 1:03 PM
  • PPO

    Polypore International (PPO +9.5%) trades up after its Q3 beat estimates on a per share basis....

    Polypore International (PPO +9.5%) trades up after its Q3 beat estimates on a per share basis. Profit leapt 90% Y/Y due to higher than anticipated sales of its lithium battery separators for hybrid and electric vehicles. Gross margin also widened to 40.5% from 37.8% on the sales jump.

     
     
     
     
    | 12:46 PM
  • LUK-OLD

    Jefferies (JEF -7.1%) defends itself against claims of heavy EU sovereign exposure made by...

    Jefferies (JEF -7.1%) defends itself against claims of heavy EU sovereign exposure made by Egan-Jones, saying on a "net" basis, the company is actually short to the tune of $38M - just 1% of capital. Without taking sides, FTAlpha notes MF Global (MF) also claimed it was hedged against its Europe exposure. Hedges aren't always perfect and there's that pesky counterparty risk.
     
     
     
     
    | 12:27 PM | 10 Comments
  • NAV

    Carl Icahn just bought another piece of Navistar (NAV +1.8%) stock, boosting his stake in the...

    Carl Icahn just bought another piece of Navistar (NAV +1.8%) stock, boosting his stake in the commercial trucking company to 9.99%, according to an SEC filing. Icahn recently made large investments in both Navistar and Oshkosh (OSK +0.2%), another trucking company, leading to speculation that he wants to combine the two.
     
     
     
     
    | 12:19 PM
  • WLL

    Shares of Whiting Petroleum (WLL -3.2%) reverse course and give back early gains, despite...

    Shares of Whiting Petroleum (WLL -3.2%) reverse course and give back early gains, despite reporting a Q3 that solidly beat estimates. Earnings more than tripled as the oil and natural-gas producer benefited from increased output and higher oil selling prices.

     
     
     
     
    | 12:15 PM
  • SONO-OLD

    SonoSite (SONO-OLD +21%) shares jump on reports that the bedside ultrasound and cardiograph...

    SonoSite (SONO-OLD +21%) shares jump on reports that the bedside ultrasound and cardiograph equipment maker is up for sale and in talks with potential buyers including Samsung (OTC:SSNLF). The company reportedly is asking for second-round bids and aims to reach a sale agreement by mid-December.
     
     
     
     
    | 12:10 PM
  • ARO

    Aeropostale (ARO +17.5%) nabs an upgrade from KeyBanc to Buy with a price target of $20 on...

    Aeropostale (ARO +17.5%) nabs an upgrade from KeyBanc to Buy with a price target of $20 on shares. Analysts with the firm point to margin improvement and "abating" market share losses for the specialty retailer in lining up its rating. The stock is on a strong run after lifting its guidance for Q3 earnings earlier.

     
     
     
     
    | 12:06 PM
  • RIG

    Transocean (RIG -10.9%) trades lower after its Q3 swung to a loss on acquisition-related charges...

    Transocean (RIG -10.9%) trades lower after its Q3 swung to a loss on acquisition-related charges and delays to the refitting of its rigs. Separately, Global Hunter and Capital One downgrade the shares on the poor results.
     
     
     
     
    | 11:56 AM | 1 Comment
  • MDVN

    Medivation's (MDVN +111.1%) blockbuster announcement on the results for testing of its prostate...

    Medivation's (MDVN +111.1%) blockbuster announcement on the results for testing of its prostate cancer treatment hits shares of rival Dendreon (DNDN -35.9%) hard - after the company was already torched by a forecast for only modest growth of its own prostate cancer therapy.

     
     
     
     
    | 11:56 AM | 1 Comment
  • MCHX

    Shares of Marchex (MCHX -12.7%) tumble after the company hits a speedbump with its Q3 earnings...

    Shares of Marchex (MCHX -12.7%) tumble after the company hits a speedbump with its Q3 earnings report. The online marketing firm swung to a profit on revenue of $39.9M (+64% Y/Y) during the period, but Q4 and full-year guidance came in lukewarm compared to the estimates of analysts.

     
     
     
     
    | 11:37 AM
  • ANRZQ

    Alpha Natural Resources (ANR +11.2%) is taking off, as the market gives a thumbs-up to its Q3...

    Alpha Natural Resources (ANR +11.2%) is taking off, as the market gives a thumbs-up to its Q3 beat. Investors might also be pleased with Alpha's expectations for strong global coal demand in 2012, including for the company's expensive metallurgical coal. Other coal stocks moving higher: BTU +2.1%. ACI +2.8%. CNX +3.4%.

     
     
     
     
    | 11:33 AM
  • RLD

    RealD (NYSE:RLD) continues to plummet, now down over -21% after saying late yesteday that...

    RealD (NYSE:RLD) continues to plummet, now down over -21% after saying late yesteday that Samsung Electronics had withdrawn from an agreement to manufacturer TV panels using its technology.
     
     
     
     
    | 11:29 AM
  • SWIR

    Sierra Wireless (SWIR -11.8%) dips after its Q3 revenue misses  estimates. Profits dropped...

    Sierra Wireless (SWIR -11.8%) dips after its Q3 revenue misses  estimates. Profits dropped 15% Y/Y, driven by the loss of revenue from Barnes & Noble (BKS -4%) and Clearwire (CLWR -10%). Not surprisingly, the company also lowers guidance for FY11, now expecting revenue of between $145M - $150M, below Street estimates for $166M. Separately, Morgan Keegan, Raymond James and RBC all downgrade the shares on the results.

     
     
     
     
    | 11:23 AM

  • Stocks and the euro are doing the "V' thing on an AP report that the Greece bailout referendum...

    Stocks and the euro are doing the "V' thing on an AP report that the Greece bailout referendum has been scrapped. Anyone following the news for the last several hours has already known this, but with the EU crisis again solved, markets are bursting higher.

     
     
     
     
    | 10:46 AM | 6 Comments
  • IAC

    InterActiveCorp (IACI +7.5%) surges after reporting Q3 revenue of $516.9M (+25% Y/Y) and EPS of...

    InterActiveCorp (IACI +7.5%) surges after reporting Q3 revenue of $516.9M (+25% Y/Y) and EPS of $0.69, beating consensus by $23.3M and $0.16, and declaring its first quarterly dividend ($0.12/share). "I think it's an outdated and somewhat inane concept that high-growth companies shouldn't pay dividends," asserts CEO Barry Diller.

     
     
     
     
    | 10:42 AM
  • TSLA

    Tesla Motors (TSLA +7.3%) gains after reporting a less-than-expected loss for Q3. Revenue jumped...

    Tesla Motors (TSLA +7.3%) gains after reporting a less-than-expected loss for Q3. Revenue jumped 85% Y/Y on a 22% increase in sales of its Tesla Roadster, pushing total sales for the car above 2K for the year. Separately, BofA Merrill Lynch ups its price target on the stock to $36.

     
     
     
     
    | 10:41 AM
  • ANF

    Abercrombie & Fitch (ANF -21.7%) shares slide after reporting Q3 sales in line at...

    Abercrombie & Fitch (ANF -21.7%) shares slide after reporting Q3 sales in line at $1.07B and citing unfavorable comps outside the U.S. While the teen retailer posted a 7% gain in same-store sales, an acceleration in the U.S. was hurt by slowing sales in Europe, including negative sales in its flagship stores there. Japan and Canada sales also were negative.
     
     
     
     
    | 10:39 AM | 1 Comment
  • GBX

    Shares of Greenbrier (GBX +13.5%) go on a tear after the firm posts strong Q4 results and says...

    Shares of Greenbrier (GBX +13.5%) go on a tear after the firm posts strong Q4 results and says it has a growing backlog of orders. The railroad equipment supplier cites a confluence of factors that it expects will create increased demand for covered hopper cars and tank cars.

     
     
     
     
    | 10:33 AM
  • LUK-OLD

    Moving down in concert with Jefferies (JEF -5.2%) is Berkshire-like Leucadia (LUK-OLD -5.8%), a...

    Moving down in concert with Jefferies (JEF -5.2%) is Berkshire-like Leucadia (LUK-OLD -5.8%), a major owner (28% stake at last check) of JEF shares. A major owner of Leucadia ... Bruce Berkowitz's troubled Fairholme Fund (MUTF:FAIRX). (earlier)
     
     
     
     
    | 10:32 AM
  • OWW

    Travel bookings site Orbitz (OWW +16.6%) rallies after posting Q3 revenue of $202.9M (+4% Y/Y)...

    Travel bookings site Orbitz (OWW +16.6%) rallies after posting Q3 revenue of $202.9M (+4% Y/Y) and EPS of $0.15, beating consensus by $4.6M and $0.09. With shares still down 60% YTD on account of market share losses to PCLN and EXPE, investors aren't bothered by the company's Q4 revenue guidance of $170M-$174M, which is below a $178.4M consensus. (.pdf)
     
     
     
     
    | 10:28 AM
  • DXCM

    Medical device maker Dexcom (DXCM -13.3%) takes a hit after its Q3 misses across the board, hurt...

    Medical device maker Dexcom (DXCM -13.3%) takes a hit after its Q3 misses across the board, hurt by lagging international sales and higher operational costs. The company says the declining sales trend is likely to continue, and lowers FY11 guidance. It now expects revenue in the range of $62.5M - $67.5M, down from prior estimates of $67.5- $72.5M. Separately, Morgan Keegan cuts the shares to Market Perform off the results.

     
     
     
     
    | 10:21 AM
  • KSWS

    K-Swiss (KSWS -30.5%) gets crushed after reporting Q3 revenue of $80.5M (+31% Y/Y) and EPS of...

    K-Swiss (KSWS -30.5%) gets crushed after reporting Q3 revenue of $80.5M (+31% Y/Y) and EPS of -$0.43, missing consensus by $7.6M and $0.16. In addition, the company expects 2011 revenue of just $260M ($278.4M consensus). K-Swiss' report stands in stark contrast to the September earnings beat posted by Nike (NKE -0.5%)

     
     
     
     
    | 10:17 AM | 1 Comment
  • LUK-OLD

    Of note concerning Jefferies (JEF -11.9%) is a downgrade by Egan-Jones noting $2.7B of...

    Of note concerning Jefferies (JEF -11.9%) is a downgrade by Egan-Jones noting $2.7B of "sovereign obligations" - equal to 77% of shareholders equity. The agency would prefer a lower leverage ratio than the current 12.9:1, though noting it's not in the same ballpark as MF Global's (MF) 40:1.

     
     
     
     
    | 10:13 AM | 5 Comments
  • LUK-OLD

    Jefferies (JEF -14.3%) shares were temporarily halted after crashing to a new 52-week low....

    Jefferies (JEF -14.3%) shares were temporarily halted after crashing to a new 52-week low. Shares have been hammered by fears regarding the company's exposure to MF Global and PIIGS sovereign debt.
     
     
     
     
    | 10:07 AM
  • TDC

    After initially trading higher post-earnings, data warehousing firm Teradata (TDC -7.5%) is now...

    After initially trading higher post-earnings, data warehousing firm Teradata (TDC -7.5%) is now selling off. While the company beat Q3 estimates and slightly lifted its 2011 EPS guidance to $2.25-$2.30 ($2.25 consensus), a trailing P/E of 26 and 40% YTD gain suggests expectations may have been even higher. (PR)

     
     
     
     
    | 10:02 AM
  • WTSL

    Shares of Wet Seal (WTSLA) fall off a cliff, declining 16.6% after the firm reports comparable...

    Shares of Wet Seal (WTSLA) fall off a cliff, declining 16.6% after the firm reports comparable store sales fell off 9.7% in October. The year-to-year comparable suffered after the company eliminated Halloween merchandise in order to expand fall sportswear. After the tough month, the firm now sees Q3 EPS falling in at $0.04, below its prior guidance of $0.05-$0.06.

     
     
     
     
    | 9:59 AM
  • DNDN

    Dendreon (DNDN -27.6%) "risks fading into irrelevancy" following the unexpected rise in...

    Dendreon (DNDN -27.6%) "risks fading into irrelevancy" following the unexpected rise in Provenge's costs and admission that sales of the prostate cancer therapy are slowing. Dendreon will not survive long with a 10% gross margin, or as cancer consultant Michael Becker quips: "Dear Dendreon, 'We lose a dollar on every sale but make it up on volume' is not a viable business model."

     
     
     
     
    | 9:43 AM
  • GPS

    Shares of Gap (NYSE:GPS) gain 1.9% after the firm reports steers Q3 guidance above the estimates...
